bib_record.title: Neutron capture cross sections of the cerium isotopes for s- and p-process studies

free_txt: - irradiation, cooling and measurement time factors;
- neutron scattering and self-shielding are accounted
for by averaging the induced activities of the two gold
Two HPGE detectors were used: 76 cm3 for CE1,
CE2 and CE3 samples and 175 cm3 for CE4, CE5 and CE6
30 mm thick metallic lithium targets of 6 mm
diameter bombarded with protons of 1912 keV.
A continuous neutron energy distribution with a high
energy cutoff at En=106 keV. The neutrons are emitted
in a forward cone of 120 degree opening angle. The
angle-integrated spectrum peaks at 25 keV and exhibits
almost exactly the shape of quasistellar neutron
Natural cerium metallic disks 10 mm in diameter
sandwiched between two 0.03 mm thick gold foils of the
same diameter directly attached to the neutron target.
The intensity of the 447.15 keV gamma-line was
corrected for the contribution from the 447.45 keV
from the devay of 143Ce (typically 15%) and for the
decay of the isomeric state to the ground state.
Total uncertainty of the activation measurement
determined from the following partial uncertainties:
